string-array.name: bench_press_tips
string-array.item: Set Up Properly – Lie on the bench with feet flat on the ground, back slightly arched, and eyes under the bar.
Grip the Bar Correctly – Use a grip slightly wider than shoulder-width, keeping wrists straight and elbows at about 75-degree angles.
Control the Descent – Lower the bar slowly to your mid-chest, keeping elbows tucked (not flared out).
Engage Your Muscles – Press the bar up with power, driving through your chest and triceps while keeping your back tight.
Use a Spotter – If lifting heavy, always have a spotter for safety and confidence.

string-array.name: treadmill_tips
string-array.item: Start Slow & Warm Up – Begin with a 5-minute walk or light jog to loosen up your muscles.
Maintain Good Posture – Keep your back straight, look forward, and avoid gripping the handrails.
Use a Slight Incline – Set the incline to 1–2% to mimic outdoor running conditions.
Focus on Your Stride – Run with a natural stride, landing midfoot, and avoid overstriding.
Cool Down Properly – Gradually slow down your pace for a few minutes before stopping.

string-array.name: squat_tips
string-array.item: Set Up Properly – Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out, and barbell resting on your upper back (not your neck).
Engage Your Core – Keep your core tight and chest up to maintain a strong, stable posture.
Control the Descent – Lower yourself by pushing your hips back and bending your knees until your thighs are at least parallel to the ground.
Drive Through Your Heels – Push up through your heels (not your toes) to engage your glutes and avoid knee strain.
Maintain Proper Alignment – Keep your knees tracking over your toes and avoid caving inward.

string-array.name: stationary_biking_tips
string-array.item: Adjust the Seat Height – Set the seat so your knee has a slight bend (about 25-30 degrees) at the bottom of the pedal stroke.
Maintain Good Posture – Keep your back straight, core engaged, and avoid hunching over the handlebars.
Use Proper Resistance – Adjust the resistance to challenge your legs without causing knee strain or excessive bouncing.
Pedal Smoothly – Use a steady cadence (RPM) rather than pushing too hard or pedaling too fast.
Engage Your Core – Keep your core tight to improve balance and efficiency.
